ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My grammatical and vocabulary skills in Italian have greatly improved and I've become much more comfortable in both listening and speaking the language.
I developed a knowledge of the Italian language as well as the culture. This course was truly beneficial to my experience at Yale and I enjoyed the class atmosphere.
I learned how to improve my knowledge of the Italian language and be able to apply the concepts that I learned in L1/L2 to conversations. I became more confident with my Italian speaking skills.
I found I really was able to develop my Italian and I was able to communicate and hold conversations with my family at home in Italian.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths are the class size, very interactive with classes of 15 or fewer, and I think the textbook is really helpful. Also the activities done in class are very helpful in preparing for the quizzes and tests. The only weaknesses are maybe needing to do more in class speaking.

The strength of this course was the level of engagement that it required and the daily work that allowed us to learn the language much more efficiently. I believe a weakness would be that we spoke English very often in class and I sometimes didn't feel prepared for oral exams.

The strengths are that you are required to only speak in Italian so you learn the language faster. A weakness is that sometimes the class moved too quickly and I was confused about certain aspects of the language.

The teachers are very nice and accommodating. However, I first had Sandro and he was a horrible teacher, so I changed sections. The teachers seemed to very disorganized and things were constantly changing. Also, this were not conveyed clearly or correctly are work or exams.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend it. I also enjoyed L2 italian much more than L1 as the pace is a little slower even though the material is a bit more difficult. Italian is a fun language and all the instructors are amazing.

I would recommend this course to another student because it was a great language to learn and Luca was a wonderful professor. This course allows the students to learn about Italian language and culture in an interesting way and the workload is not excessive.
I would recommend this class to another student because I like that the way that this class was taught. I felt like I learned a lot. Also, my professor was great so I really enjoyed the class!
I love the Italian departments as they are always fun and friendly. The workload is manageable and coming from learning Spanish before in high school, Italian is a great transition.
